result.execSummary:
The defendant Deron L Ford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or civil judgment---DV surcharge does not apply. Restitution is set at zero. Cash bail to apply.

Obtain GED/HSED.
Obtain and maintain employment.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

No contact with victim, K.W. and Lakiva W.
No physical discipline of children---No childcare other than his children.

Successfully complete "Batterer's Intervention" counseling and continue programming.
Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
Attend and complete parenting classes---(if needed again).
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deron L Ford

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Denying Request for Good Time, signed and filed.   mld
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mel Flanagan, Br. 4, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for good time.

Defendant Deron L Ford in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Courts finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
 The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, with credit for 6 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR AND 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR AND 6 MONTHS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions:  
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS 
   in the House of Correction.  FORTHWITH.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Attend and complete parenting classes 
   --- (if needed again).
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, K.W. and Lakiva W. 
* No physical discipline of children.  
  --- No childcare other than his children.  
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, during 
   period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.  
   Cash bail to apply.
   --- DV surcharge does not apply.  
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank 
   and pay all appropriate costs.
* Restitution is set at zero.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
 Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  
 AS TO AMENDED CHARGE: Defendant examined as to the plea.  Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 9-25-2014 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Deron L Ford in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 "On states motion, Court AMENDED the Charge to Child Abuse Recklessly Cause Harm, Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 948.03(3)(b), a Class I Felony."   mld

Defendant Deron L Ford in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Case recalled.  The Court will maintain the Jury Trial date of 7-28-2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 4.  All conditions of bail including the no contact order are continued until further order of the Court.   mld

Attorney Alexis R Liggins in court.  Abbey M DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defense counsel talked to defendant, that due to confusion, thought that the next date was the date of trial on 7-28-2014.  Case passed at the request of defense counsel, who will advise defendant to come directly to the Court.  mld

Defendant Deron L Ford in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Abbey M DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Pretrial Conference held off the record. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-26-2014 at 1:30 pm and Jury Trial on 7-28-2014 at 8:30 am.  mld

Defendant Deron L Ford in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 4.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deron L Ford in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 The Hon. Jeffrey Wagner for the Hon. Mel Flanagan.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for Arraignment Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-8-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

14RM016066  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-22-14

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with K.W. (3/31/09).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Defendant Deron L Ford in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Defendant Deron L Ford in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge DALLET.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge FLANAGAN, Br. 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
